question_category.name: Default for rosary101
question_category.info: The default category for questions in this course.

question.name: First Prayer on Crucifix
question.questiontext: Which prayer is said while holding the crucifix at the very beginning of the Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct! The Apostles' Creed is prayed while holding the crucifix.
Incorrect. The Our Father comes after the Creed, on the first bead.
Incorrect. The Hail Mary comes after the Our Father.
Incorrect. The Glory Be is prayed after the three Hail Marys.

question.name: Hail Mary Source
question.questiontext: The first part of the Hail Mary ('Hail Mary, full of grace...blessed is the fruit of thy womb') comes from which source?

answer.answertext: Scripture - the words of Gabriel and Elizabeth
answer.feedback: Correct! Luke 1:28 (Gabriel) and Luke 1:42 (Elizabeth).

answer.answertext: The writings of St. Thomas Aquinas
answer.feedback: Incorrect. The words come directly from Scripture.
Incorrect. The words come from the Gospel of Luke.
Incorrect. Pius V added the second part, but the first part is from Scripture.

question.name: Number of Hail Marys
question.questiontext: How many Hail Marys are prayed in ONE decade of the Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct! A 'decade' means ten Hail Marys.
Incorrect. There are 5 decades, but each decade has 10 Hail Marys.
Incorrect. 50 is the total in all five decades combined.
Incorrect. Three Hail Marys are prayed at the beginning, but each decade has 10.

question.name: Our Father Source
question.questiontext: The Our Father (Lord's Prayer) was taught directly by Jesus to his disciples.

answer.feedback: Correct! Jesus taught this prayer in Matthew 6:9-13.
Incorrect. The Our Father comes directly from Jesus' teaching in the Gospels.

question.name: Fatima Prayer Required
question.questiontext: The Fatima Prayer ('O my Jesus, forgive us our sins...') is required to pray a valid Rosary.

answer.feedback: Incorrect. The Fatima Prayer is optional, though many Catholics include it.
Correct! The Fatima Prayer is a popular addition but not required.

question.name: Hail Holy Queen When
question.questiontext: When is the Hail Holy Queen (Salve Regina) prayed?

answer.feedback: Correct! It's the closing prayer after the five decades.
Incorrect. It comes at the end of the Rosary.
Incorrect. The Glory Be comes after each decade.
Incorrect. It's prayed every time at the end of the Rosary.

question.name: Three Hail Marys Purpose
question.questiontext: The three Hail Marys at the beginning of the Rosary are traditionally offered for an increase in which virtues?

answer.feedback: Correct! These are the three theological virtues.
Incorrect. Those are cardinal virtues. The three Hail Marys are for the theological virtues.
Incorrect. The traditional intention is for faith, hope, and charity.
Incorrect. The traditional intention is for faith, hope, and charity.

question.name: Complete the Prayer
question.questiontext: Complete this line from the Hail Mary: 'Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us ______'

question.name: Total Decades
question.questiontext: How many decades are in a standard Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct! A standard Rosary has 5 decades.
Incorrect. There are 10 Hail Marys per decade, but only 5 decades total.
Incorrect. 15 decades would be a full rosary of the original three mysteries.
Incorrect. 20 is the total number of mysteries, but a standard Rosary prays 5.

question.name: Large Bead Prayer
question.questiontext: Which prayer is said on the LARGE beads of the Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct! The large beads mark the Our Father at the start of each decade.
Incorrect. Hail Marys are prayed on the small beads.
Incorrect. The Glory Be is prayed in the space between decades.
Incorrect. The Creed is prayed on the crucifix, not the beads.

question.name: Order of Prayers
question.questiontext: Put these prayers in the correct order for the BEGINNING of the Rosary:

question.name: Beads Required
question.questiontext: You must have rosary beads to pray the Rosary validly.

answer.feedback: Incorrect. You can count on your fingers or use other methods.
Correct! Beads are helpful but not required. You can count on your fingers.

question.name: Rosary Time
question.questiontext: Approximately how long does it take to pray a complete five-decade Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct! A typical Rosary takes about 15-20 minutes.
Incorrect. That would be very rushed. A full Rosary takes longer.
Incorrect. Unless praying very slowly, a Rosary doesn't take that long.
Incorrect. That would be quite slow. Typically 15-20 minutes.

question.name: Centerpiece Location
question.questiontext: Where is the centerpiece (medal) located on a rosary?

answer.answertext: Between the introductory beads and the main loop of five decades
answer.feedback: Correct! It connects the stem to the circle.

answer.answertext: At the very end after the crucifix
answer.feedback: Incorrect. The crucifix is at the end of the stem.
Incorrect. The decades are separated by single large beads.

answer.answertext: There is no centerpiece on a rosary
answer.feedback: Incorrect. Most rosaries have a centerpiece or medal.

question.name: Total Mystery Sets
question.questiontext: How many sets of mysteries are there in the Rosary?

answer.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. The Luminous Mysteries were added in 2002.
Incorrect. There are 4 sets, each with 5 mysteries.
Incorrect. There are 20 total mysteries, but only 4 sets.

question.name: Luminous Added By
question.questiontext: Who added the Luminous Mysteries to the Rosary in 2002?

answer.feedback: Correct! He added them in his apostolic letter Rosarium Virginis Mariae.
Incorrect. It was John Paul II in 2002.
Incorrect. It was John Paul II in 2002.
Incorrect. St. Dominic lived in the 13th century.

question.name: Match Mystery to Day
question.questiontext: Match each set of mysteries to the day(s) they are traditionally prayed:

question.name: First Joyful Mystery
question.questiontext: What is the FIRST Joyful Mystery?

answer.feedback: Correct! Gabriel announces to Mary that she will conceive Jesus.
Incorrect. That is the second Joyful Mystery.
Incorrect. That is the third Joyful Mystery.
Incorrect. That is a Luminous Mystery, not Joyful.

question.name: Sorrowful Focus
question.questiontext: The Sorrowful Mysteries focus on which part of Jesus' life?

answer.feedback: Correct! The Sorrowful Mysteries cover the Passion.
Incorrect. That's the Joyful Mysteries.
Incorrect. That's the Luminous Mysteries.
Incorrect. That's the Glorious Mysteries.

question.name: Wedding at Cana
question.questiontext: The Wedding at Cana is part of which set of mysteries?

answer.feedback: Correct! It's the second Luminous Mystery.
Incorrect. The Joyful Mysteries cover the Incarnation and infancy.
Incorrect. The Glorious Mysteries focus on the Resurrection and beyond.
Incorrect. The Sorrowful Mysteries cover the Passion.

question.name: Fifth Glorious Mystery
question.questiontext: What is the FIFTH (last) Glorious Mystery?

answer.answertext: The Coronation of Mary as Queen of Heaven
answer.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. That is the fourth Glorious Mystery.

answer.answertext: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
answer.feedback: Incorrect. That is the third Glorious Mystery.
Incorrect. That is the first Glorious Mystery.

question.name: Must Follow Schedule
question.questiontext: You MUST pray the mysteries according to the traditional daily schedule (e.g., Joyful on Monday).

answer.feedback: Incorrect. The schedule is a suggestion, not a requirement.
Correct! You may pray any mysteries on any day. The schedule is just a tradition.

question.name: Agony in Garden
question.questiontext: 'The Agony in the Garden' is which mystery?

answer.feedback: Correct! Jesus prays in Gethsemane before his arrest.
Incorrect. The first Glorious Mystery is the Resurrection.
Incorrect. That is the Finding in the Temple.
Incorrect. The second Sorrowful Mystery is the Scourging.

question.name: Mysteries per Set
question.questiontext: How many individual mysteries are in EACH set (Joyful, Luminous, Sorrowful, Glorious)?

question.name: Rosary Definition
question.questiontext: The Rosary is best described as:

answer.feedback: Correct! The Rosary is rooted in Scripture and focused on the life of Christ.

answer.answertext: A prayer only for advanced Catholics
answer.feedback: Incorrect. The Rosary is for everyone, beginners included.

answer.answertext: A prayer that replaced the Mass
answer.feedback: Incorrect. The Rosary complements but does not replace the Mass.

answer.answertext: A prayer invented in the 20th century
answer.feedback: Incorrect. The Rosary has roots going back to the Middle Ages.

question.name: Fatima Request
question.questiontext: At Fatima in 1917, Our Lady asked the children to:

answer.answertext: Pray the Rosary every day for peace
answer.feedback: Correct! Our Lady of Fatima emphasized daily Rosary prayer.
Incorrect. She asked for daily prayer.
Incorrect. She encouraged the Rosary strongly.
Incorrect. She encouraged all the mysteries.

question.name: Mary Focus
question.questiontext: Although many prayers in the Rosary are addressed to Mary, the Rosary is ultimately Christ-centered because we meditate on the life of Jesus.

answer.feedback: Correct! Mary leads us to Jesus through the mysteries.
Incorrect. The Rosary IS Christ-centered through meditation on Jesus' life.

question.name: Total Hail Marys
question.questiontext: How many Hail Marys are in a complete five-decade Rosary (not counting the opening three)?

answer.feedback: Correct! 5 decades 10 Hail Marys = 50.
Incorrect. 53 would include the opening three, but the question asks for the decades only.
Incorrect. That would be 10 decades.
Incorrect. 150 was the original psalter connection, but a standard Rosary has 50.

question.name: Meditation Meaning
question.questiontext: To 'meditate' on a mystery while praying the Rosary means to:

answer.answertext: Picture the scene in your mind and reflect on its meaning
answer.feedback: Correct! Meditation involves visualization and reflection.
Incorrect. Christian meditation fills the mind with sacred images.
Incorrect. Meditation involves slowing down and contemplating.
Incorrect. Meditation is an interior focus on the mystery.

question.name: Intention Purpose
question.questiontext: Offering an 'intention' for your Rosary means:

answer.answertext: Praying for a specific person, cause, or need
answer.feedback: Correct! We can offer our Rosary for any worthy intention.
Incorrect. An intention is what you're praying FOR, not when.
Incorrect. An intention is the purpose of your prayer.
Incorrect. The Rosary can be prayed in any language.

question.name: Mind Wandering
question.questiontext: If your mind wanders during the Rosary, you should stop praying and start over from the beginning.

answer.feedback: Incorrect. Simply bring your mind gently back and continue.
Correct! Distractions are normal. Just refocus and continue praying.

question.name: Sacramental Definition
question.questiontext: Rosary beads are classified as a:

answer.feedback: Correct! Sacramentals are sacred objects that help us grow in holiness.
Incorrect. There are only 7 sacraments, and the rosary is not one of them.
Incorrect. Relics are objects associated with saints.
Incorrect. Icons are sacred images.

question.name: Best Habit Advice
question.questiontext: What is the BEST advice for building a daily Rosary habit?

answer.answertext: Start small (even one decade) and anchor it to an existing routine
answer.feedback: Correct! Small, consistent steps build lasting habits.

answer.answertext: Only pray when you feel perfectly focused
answer.feedback: Incorrect. Waiting for perfect conditions means rarely praying.

answer.answertext: Pray 15 decades immediately from day one
answer.feedback: Incorrect. Starting too big often leads to burnout.
Incorrect. The Rosary can be prayed anywhere.

question.name: Closing Prayer
question.questiontext: Which prayer includes the line 'To thee do we cry, poor banished children of Eve'?

answer.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. The Creed is a profession of faith.
Incorrect. The Our Father addresses God the Father.
Incorrect. The Hail Mary is shorter and different.
